title: A Beginner’s Guide to Booty Clapping

steps.title: Stand with your feet together and relax your butt.
steps.content: Stand with your feet together and relax your butt. Your feet should be at a normal stance with your feet under your hips, but less than shoulder-width apart. [2] X Research source Focus on bringing your booty down with each movement to clap your butt cheeks together. [3] X Research source Keep your feet and legs together, and relax your entire body—do not squeeze your butt cheeks! Try putting your hands against a wall for support. steps.title: Alternatively, keep your feet flat and bend your knees quickly.
steps.content: Alternatively, keep your feet flat and bend your knees quickly. Instead of bouncing on your toes, you can move your knees to make your booty clap. steps.title: Rise onto your tippy toes and move your heels in and out.

When you do this, both of your ankles will go inward at the same time, then outward at the same time. This is the basic movement you want to do across your legs so your butt cheeks clap together. When you rotate your thighs inward, your butt will go in. [8] X Research source If you’re struggling to make your booty clap, think of rotating your knees inward and outward. steps.title: Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
steps.content: Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Straighten your legs and keep your butt as loose as possible. steps.title: Bend your knees and rotate them in and out.

[12] X Research source Keep in mind that nailing the booty clap takes a lot of practice. If you don’t get it the first time, keep trying and record yourself to see if you’re doing something wrong.
